website_summaries.verdict: For dancers who are tired of replacing jazz shoes every few weeks, these may last quite a bit longer.
pros: Comfortable and flexible, and light enough for challenging rehearsals
Fits even wide feet well, thanks to lace-up feature
Very durable and long-lasting compared to other jazz shoes
cons: Sole is a bit grippy, making turns difficult
May need a bit of time to break in
Sole can fray at the ball of the foot

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended to Anyone With Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long-time dancer with broad feet and had never owned wide-enough shoes till now. These in a wide size have been WONDERFUL to wear and in fact have improved my dance performance. Highly recommended to anyone with wide feet. I did size up a half size from my street shoe size; I wear a 6.5 W in a street shoe and bought these in a 7 W.
customer_reviews.author: HunterJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Social Dancing
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these in the past but wore them out. I bought new ones at a local shop (spent FAR too much on them...) that I was never as happy with. These have a more plastic than rubber forefoot and heel pad that allow for great spinning. I normally wear a 7.5 in a flat or heels and a 8 in tennis shoes. I ordered a 7.5 and they fit just like socks (snug, like they should be).
customer_reviews.author: S. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Way Small But A Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a 7 1/2 to occasionally a size 8. Medium width or occasionally wide. I bought an eight wide. NOT EVEN CLOSE. Sent them back and got a nine W. PERFECT!! She has cavus foot which gives her MANY problems. She can tell if a shoe is comfortable in seconds. She wore them to shop for groceries today. If there had been ANY issues she would have returned in pain. NO PAIN. I'm going to buy her other pairs from the manufacturer. I'm just SOOOO happy because she's in pain a lot but not today!!
customer_reviews.author: Typical Geek

customer_reviews.title: Slide nicely on a dance floor
customer_reviews.text: These light weight shoes slide nicely on the dance floor. I use them for my Nia dancing since I have RA in my feet and can't dance barefoot.They were a little tight initially so I used a metal stretcher for one day to widen the toe in a little. Then they were fine. I ordered a wide wideth but it wasn't quite wide enough; it's fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Bought them for Zumba
customer_reviews.text: I know these are jazz shoes, but I bought them for Zumba as my regular sneakers stuck to the floor too much. These shoes give me the flexibility I want and need to turn, twist and move freely. Not much support, but I didn't expect it. I did read all the reviews before purchasing them and most people said they ran a half size small so I bought a size 8 although I am usually a 7 1/2. The 8 fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Women: order the same size as your street shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fit as a jazz shoe should: like a glove. After reading so many reviews about sizing issues, I was hesitant to buy them, but once I visited Capezio's website to view their sizing chart, I took a chance and ordered them. They were of great quality and were able to get me through an hour and a half of dance class without problem. I would definitely recommend these shoes to anyone looking for a good, durable dance shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife ordered this pair for herself
customer_reviews.text: I think that once you know the manufacturer and the shoe style, you can safely order on line, and get the item conveniently delivered and at a better price. My size 10.5 foot won't fit in the size 8.5 shoe, so I'll have to take my wife's word for it that they're comfortable, water-resistant, and durable; her last pair lasted a couple of years in daily use.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Exchanged - Ordered 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered my street shoe size and according to the measuring chart. The fit of a 7 1/2 was a little snug. Still able to dance in them but not 100% comfortably. Ordered a second pair 1/2 larger. When I received the size 8 there was only one shoe in the damaged box. That got returned and another pair was sent. The 1/2 size up made a difference. The quality of the shoes are good and just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lann

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great for dancing once you wear them in
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for dancing once you wear them in. They were definitely narrow and since I have flat, wide feet you could imagine they were very uncomfortable for a while but I kept wearing them because I knew once I wore them in they would fit like glove...and they did! I'm a 10.5 men btw, so going a full size or size and a half is definitely recommended. I put stick-on suede on the bottom of them so I can't say how the original rubber soles work in terms of grip and the ability to spin, I use them for Salsa
customer_reviews.author: PrimeLiner

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great for my purposes (contra dancing)
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for my purposes (contra dancing). They're comfortable, have a good sole for spinning on a hardwood floor, and stay on my feet through hours of dancing. I usually wear 9 or 9.5 and the 9.5s I ordered fit well. I have wide feet and the shoes feel comfortable--the leather conforms well. I've worn them to weekly dances (2-3 hours per dance) for about 2 months and there is minimal wear on the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Tooooo right in the toes!
customer_reviews.text: They probably be really really comfortable if they fit. I would suggest buying a size or maybe even a size and a half larger than you would normally wear if your feet are wide at all.
customer_reviews.author: gimpy57

customer_reviews.title: WIDE FOOT WONDER! :-)
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are wonderful for this price. I wear a 10 wide to 10 1/2 wide in street shoes, depending on the shoe. The 11 1/2 wide in these are a perfect fit. They are so comfortable I even wear them to work sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mona

customer_reviews.title: I am not a fan of these unfortunately. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of these unfortunately. I ordered my regular size but they were too big and I had a hard time keeping them intact during dance. This is a bit gross and TMI, but I thought I'd mention it just in case it has something to do with the material. I also have a problem with sweaty feet in these, which I find very interesting as I don't get sweaty feet normally. I am not sure if it's the material or what, but I think I will be sticking with my foot undies instead of these.
customer_reviews.author: Aklay1206

customer_reviews.title: Adult Dance Class
customer_reviews.text: I have over 20 years experience taking dance classes and I began teaching adults and younger children in the last few years. I have previously used this shoe for jazz as a high school student. I was looking for a versatile shoe that would give me a bit more heel support for long hours of teaching after working a full time job. Flexibility of a ballet shoe with a bit more heel comfort for long days!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is perfect, fits exactly right and is a wonderful "character" ...
customer_reviews.text: Capezio never gets it wrong. This shoe is perfect, fits exactly right and is a wonderful "character" shoe for stage use as well as a dance shoe. I bought them to wear with a costume in a 1940s stage play, and was worried about the split sole, but it wasn't a problem at all. It's soft and comfortable and looks great, even on my size 10 foot!
customer_reviews.author: Dramagal

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not really
customer_reviews.text: Well, I had to order half size larger then my usual size, which means ordering, sending back, re-ordering... hassle... But it is not even the biggest problem. The front inside piece does not stay in place, it slides to the side ( left on left foot, right or right), which means the metal holes hit the foot. And it hurts if you are using this shoes for an hour or more... Larger size fits better, but has the same sliding problem. Had to wear socks. Does not look that great, but comfortable enough for dance practice.
customer_reviews.author: Yelena

customer_reviews.title: Very snug
customer_reviews.text: Last minute buy for spring recital. Other reviews are right--this shoe runs very small. Ordered a 5.5 for my daughter who wears a size 4. Yes, dance shoes tend to run smaller than street shoes, but bear in mind that at one and a half sizes up, it's still a close fit. Bought these in May, will need a new pair for Fall season. Also, thin laces are hard to manage with little kid fingers. They work as a jazz shoe, but would not buy again at this price. They are durable just too snug.
customer_reviews.author: Bellamy Gracel

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but good construction
customer_reviews.text: I take a senior dance aerobics class & these are perfect! Regular (street) tennis shoes were too heavy, but the are light weight & seem to be appropriate for polished wood floors. The only con is size - can’t wear socks so next time I will try half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ahearn

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes - go 1/2 size up for best fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a 1/2 size up and they are perfect. I love the feel of them - it's like I'm dancing barefooted when I'm not. The laces leave something to be desired. But for the price, I recommend these highly. I've always loved capezios. They are my go to dance shoe of choice. These are a great, low end alternative to the pricier leather sole version.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Helené

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Reviews showed that these shoes ran small so I ordered a complete size up and still were to small.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Soto

customer_reviews.title: Okay if you have another shoe
customer_reviews.text: They are great for salsa shoes but they don't seem like some lasting shoes. I wear a 9.5 but bought a 10 they are hard to break in. I would not buy them again because they are not sturdy enough. I am going to keep because I need another pair of salsa shoes flats for practice...
customer_reviews.author: Mzzz Hart

customer_reviews.title: Nice Indoor Shoe for Dance or Just Wear
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought my usual size. My experience with dance shoes in the past has been that they run small so I bought a size larger than I would normally. It's better to have more room than be too short and I wear these indoors as slippers. I will also use them in the winter time to take when I need boots to get somewhere but want a light shoe to wear indoors.
customer_reviews.author: lulu4magik

customer_reviews.title: Narrow and long
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger, because of the reviews. I also ordered wide. It was too narrow, but I do have exceptionally wide feet. I would say that the wide was more like a comfortable medium for most people. The length felt like a true ladies 7.5. I had plenty of length leftover in the toe, just not enough width. Also the shoe was "lasted" short in the ball of the foot, so I felt as if I was walking on a bump. It was uncomfortably annoying. That was probably also due to it being too long for me. In an average street shoe, I wear a women's 6.5 wide.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Marie

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, poor service.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, but it was a little bit big. The ad said the 13 M black shoe, which I purchased, was free returns. But turns out I have to pay to return the shoes and pay a return processing fee. I have contacted the seller, but I can’t get an answer that explains what’s going on. Quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: happy parent

customer_reviews.title: 9 wide ordered - Feel really good, easy on and off.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to take these shoes on and off. Ordered a 9 wide. They feel great on and i am happy with my purchase. My Standard shoe size is a 9-9.5 or a 9w. These fit and will work for the purpose I purchased them (theatre-dancing in musicals) however of I was a serious dancer, I would have needed to send them back for an 8.5w.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T.

customer_reviews.title: Far too small for the size ordered
customer_reviews.text: I sized up and bought the wide fitting and still couldn't get my foot inside the shoe. I'm not going to order another size and play the guessing game of 'I wonder what shoe size actually corresponds to my shoe size' and end up returning shoe after shoe, so I'll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Heffner

customer_reviews.title: Material was a very soft leather that fit the foot like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Shoe fit snug without sock or stocking. Material was a very soft leather that fit the foot like a glove. No street walking in these cuties, because you would feel every rock or uneven crack on the road. I personally need a brick & mortar location to try shoe on before purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Corby2Nicks

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but great for people with bunions and for portability!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply built but perfect for carrying to dances and for preventing knee injuries. Works for me as an occasional dancer.
customer_reviews.author: embsa

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had to have these for performing in school musicals. She cannot wear the kind with the heels so this was a great option. She said they were not slick on the bottom, did not feel loose like they would fly off at any time, and felt great.
customer_reviews.author: MsSCMomof4

customer_reviews.title: Wear well
customer_reviews.text: I have danced probably hundreds of miles in these things and love them. They are not ballet slippers by a long shot, but they are comfortable and perfect for what I need. I got a size up, but I should have purchased my size in W and left it at that - they're supposed to be a little tight, and stretch. Other than laces that broke on the first wearing (my recommendation is to buy a package of laces to replace both with, and do it as soon as they come out of the box), and not quite enough padding in the heels to keep stomping on hardwood from stinging a little, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Teikvah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dance shoe and great for country line dance too
customer_reviews.text: Excellent dance shoe and great for country line dance too! I use them for most of my workouts except areobics. Tried with yoga which was helpful and worked well with weight training too! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Talon

customer_reviews.title: very narrow. I thought the "W" meant wide and ...
customer_reviews.text: very narrow. I thought the "W" meant wide and i guess it meant womens and not mens. My first time ordering so was not savvy.
customer_reviews.author: sherlock

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, a bit tight on turns
customer_reviews.text: The synthetic sole is a bit grippy. Turns require more effort. I can do a single pirouette in them, so the friction isn't as bad as it seems. The front sole is a lot bigger than a normal ballet suede sole. As for size, I wear a men's 10.5 street shoe. Capezio suggested a size 12.5; those were just a bit big without socks.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I take a size 6 shoe average width. I ordered a size 7. It was too short and too narrow. I returned them
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: wide is not wide
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are light weight, and leather, so for someone with a narrow foot they would be very good. For that I would give it 5 stars. We bought them because my daughter has a wide foot and these are available in wide sizes. She measures for a size 5 on the charts, so we ordered a 6W. The length was just a little too long, but that would have been acceptable. It is not by any stretch of the imagination a wide shoe. We tried multiple strategies to stretch the forefoot (rendering it unreturnable of course) but did not succeed in widening it enough to make it wearable for her. For us I would give it 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ResearchingMom

customer_reviews.title: wore out immediately
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter was VERY happy when these arrived and for once did not criticize my choice of gifts! they are very comfortable and soft. However, the shoes began to fray next to the pad at the ball of the foot very quickly. She even uses them only on stage and they are still worn through already after only a month of use. I suspect that these shoes will not meet her needs and we will need to find shoes with a sole that covers more of the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for starting dancers
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use these all the time, but I imagine that if I did they wouldn’t last. They work for me since I go swing dancing about once or twice a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit like a glove...
customer_reviews.text: They are quite comfortably snug and fit like a glove. I really enjoyed using these for Latin dancing to keep my feet more comfortable than when I wear heels and to keep me from being so tall while I dance (I am 5'10") with my shorter friends. I normally wear a size 10 and these 10's fit perfectly with enough flexibility in the material that even with my big toe up against the front of the shoe, it didn't feel tight or sore. =)
customer_reviews.author: Tania P.

customer_reviews.title: These provide a nice, small amount of arch support without an orthotic ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9.5 shoe and ordered a 9.5 in these jazz shoes. They were initially just a teeny bit tight, but that's exactly what you want in a dance shoe. They naturally stretched to the shape of my foot over time. Additionally, having had plantar fasciitis in the past, I can't be barefoot, I need arch support. These provide a nice, small amount of arch support without an orthotic needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Hart

customer_reviews.title: They fitted exact. I cant wear socks with them ...
customer_reviews.text: They fitted exact. I cant wear socks with them. My size is 7.5 so I ordered 8.5 next time I will order size 9
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Walkes

customer_reviews.title: Theater shoes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in theater musicals and needed this type of shoe to dance about the stage. Each year she has gotten better, so I thought it was time to get her a good shoe. When I saw these I thought the price was good, then delivery was fast and my daughter has enjoyed dancing in them. The quality is very good and so for the last two weeks she has used them hard preparing for her musical. She is happy with them and that is what is important. Thank you for the service you provided and I'm sure we will be back for another pair from you.
customer_reviews.author: JRB III

customer_reviews.title: Great dance shoe
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 7 wide, so I ordered a 7.5 and the fit was perfect and the shoe was comfortable. It's the first time I've ever worn a dance shoe and so I have nothing to compare it to. I have a lot of foot issues, and I wore the shoe for several hours a day for a period of three days and had no problems with my feet. I plan on purchasing another pair for my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Groovin Granny

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes for my dance classes and they fit true to size and are very snug. These are high quality shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Quality was good but the fit was pathetic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these twice coz they were a bit cheaper than the local stores. The first time I ordered them in 3Y and they were like the 3 month baby size. Couldn't believe that and asked them to be replaced with Women's size 3 and was extremely dissapointed that the size was like for the 3 year olds and didn't fit my 6 year old daughter. I cannot even suggest as to how many sizes up you may have to go coz their online chart is way off. You may want to speak with the seller before placing an order.
customer_reviews.author: webbie HK

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but order up a half size!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. DEFINITELY order a half-size up. I'm normally an 11, but ordered up since the reviews said the shoes ran small. I'm so glad I did since a 11.5 fit like a glove. I can't imagine how an 11 would have fit. Otherwise, the construction seems good, especially for the price. Haven't yet used them for dancing, but I have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: NPA23

customer_reviews.title: Love These Shoes For Zumba
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. I wear them to Zumba and my feet feel light - as though I could really dance. I don’t know why more women wear them. I am a size 8 however I ordered a size 9 as I wear them with socks.
customer_reviews.author: Dollars & Sense

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: My right foot fit great! The left foot was slightly tight. I am a 7.5 in street shoe and had to order an 8.5. After wearing them one night at the studio, they are OK. I need to buy different laces since these ones aren’t the greatest they aren’t stretchy enough for my liking.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoes, size runs very narrow.
customer_reviews.text: These dance shoes are absolutely beautiful but not only were they not at all wide but seemed unusually narrow. I would do anything to find smooth sole shoes in an extra wide width but can't seem to. As I said, the shoes are beautiful and seems excellent.
customer_reviews.author: dottie  t

customer_reviews.title: They fit just fine. I will keep them but would not order ...
customer_reviews.text: Received them quite quickly. Surprised by how thin the Leather is. Not much support. I wear a size 9 and street shoes and ordered a 10 1/2. They fit just fine. I will keep them but would not order another pair
customer_reviews.author: Sara O Richards

customer_reviews.title: really a cheap awfulshoe
customer_reviews.text: save your money ... don't buy this shoe. I threw mine away by leaving them on the street
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes/bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was not all that great, meaning the box was crushed and tape/ cellophane was haphazardly wrapped around the box however, this did not affect the shoes themselves. I purchased one size up due to all the comments regarding size, I should have went up a size and a half . I am considering returning them and getting the 9 1/2 for a size 8 that I normally wear. They are nice shoes for sure. Probabably would have given 5 stars if they were packaged better.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are studio dance shoes - fit beautifully, soft, flexible, comfortable - have only used them for hour-long dance sessions of line-dancing on wood floors. Perfect for the purpose intended. Excellent price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mx.

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I am usually a size 6.5, but when it comes to dancing shoes I always order half a size up. Order 7 and it fits great!! Arrived fast!
customer_reviews.author: sandra mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Too Small.
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. I’m on average a 7 and I even ordered a half size bigger and it fit like a size 4.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Size?
customer_reviews.text: We tried a regular width and then a wide width and both were too tight. There actually didn't seem much difference the two pair in the fit. Wish we were able to get a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Kreig

customer_reviews.title: This jazz shoe fits my daughter perfect! I did call the manufacture to make sure ...
customer_reviews.text: This jazz shoe fits my daughter perfect ! I did call the manufacture to make sure what size to order my daighter, then after I ordered that same shoe on here and done. Great shoe for a great value .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter usually wears a women's 7.5, ordered the 8 as per other reviews and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel NY

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is excellent, sizing is a problem
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is excellent, sizing is a problem. My son outgrew his kids' size 1.5, which is as high as the sizes go in Children's. He needs a 2. Women's starts at 3. I called Capezio and they said 3 is kids size 1, and to order a Women's 4 if he needs a 2. It is WAY too big. I don't even know what to do now because they say a 3.5 is a 1.5, which he just outgrew. Capezio needs to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Order a size and a half  up
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the shoe seems very good. However my child wears a 3.5 in big kids and this 3.5 was about 2 sizes too small. I bought a 7.5 for myself and my usual size is 6 or sometime 6.5. Order up at least 1 size, maybe 2 depending on which width you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: Reader 21

customer_reviews.title: Order more than 1 size up
customer_reviews.text: We needed shoes like this asap and these were the only ones we could find on amazon that would get to us in time. They look good, but they were much smaller than we expected. We ordered a full size up and they are still really really tight. A week with lots of wear hasn't stretched them enough to be comfortable. You should be fine if you order more than 1 size up.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They stated they came a little small. Thought I had bought large enough going 1/2 size up. My fault?
customer_reviews.author: Sandi Feldhaus

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these shoes for a stage production, and ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these shoes for a stage production, and I went up a 1/2 size to make sure they would fit okay. They showed up, and were too small. Luckily, I was able to resell them to another cast member, so I could order another pair that is a full size up from what I normally wear. Buy them BIG!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Curtis

customer_reviews.title: These are so comfortable. I keep them at work to switch over ...
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfortable. I keep them at work to switch over to when my feet get sore. They feel like socks but look like Capezio street shoes. No one can tell they are Jazz shoes and my feet are in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Too big for me, even with only half size up
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 7 in shoes. Some reviews stated that it was better to go a size bigger, others said a size smaller. I went half a size bigger because I thought I'd be safe if the shoes were too small or that it wouldn't be too big since it's only half a size bigger. It's too big. I have a good inch of toe space in there, and I should've gotten a smaller size so the shoe could loosen up with wear. Personally I would maybe go with your street shoe size or even a half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: 1nkblotTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: these shoes are exactly as expected. i've switched to heals though since getting more into latin dance
customer_reviews.author: Lbrown

customer_reviews.title: Shim Sham Shimmy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to practice tap without making noise or scarring the floors. The old style had smooth suede bottoms but these have some traction on them. I decided to give them a try and they are working out fine for me, not as sticky as I had feared. I wear a 6.5 and have an arch and the 6.5 size fit me perfectly. I also have Capezio tap and ballet shoes in this size and they are holding up well to constant use.
customer_reviews.author: angelfood

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I needed some nice-looking flat shoes to dance in, as I sprained my ankle a couple of months ago and really needed to not wear my 4-inch Tango heels for awhile. I'm an instructor, so unfortunately, not dancing at all wasn't really an option for me. I went back and forth on what size I should order for awhile since I normally wear 7.5, but often wear 7 or even 6.5 in dance shoes. After comparing reviews I eventually settled on 7.5, which ended up being perfect. At first they were a little snug, particularly putting the most pressure on the big toenails, but they eventually stretched out comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves them
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in theatre productions and they have to have jazz shoes for their performances. She has other jazz shoes but because her feet are narrow the shoes feel floppy on her feet, its really hard to find shoes that actually fit her little feet. She loves the lace up shoes, they feel more secure when she dances and moves around on stage. I earned a lot of good mommy points with these shoes. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: crafty lady

customer_reviews.title: VERY small...
customer_reviews.text: My daugher wears a 5.5 and these were WAY too small. Had to send back and find something else. Otherwise, I did like the quality.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: order one size bigger than your shoe size
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's shoe size is usually 6,5, sometimes she buys 7 (mainly in boots) so after I've read the reviews I've ordered 1 size bigger, a 7,5 which fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: These fit extremely small!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure who does these people sizing but I've had to fight for and my daughter is a to thinking that we could put them aside and she could not give her Fortune to them and my daughter is not large. She is Tiny. And a true one and a half to two. So beware of these are sized wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Foreman

customer_reviews.title: I recommend buying a full size up especially if you have ...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend buying a full size up especially if you have wide feet. My street size is 7. Based on the reviews I bought a 7 1/2 but it is a little close. Guess it will stretch. Other than that I am quite pleased with it. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Well made shoes, but definitely not for someone with wide feet. I ordered (& received) shoes that were labeled 'wide' but they are not truly for wide feet. Couldn't even get them on. Returned them immediately. Still hunting for dancing shoes that will actually fit wide feet!
customer_reviews.author: K A H

customer_reviews.title: Nice jazz shoe.
customer_reviews.text: After reading researching and reading many reviews, I ordered this jazz shoe for my teenage daughter. I ordered 1/2 size up based on the reviews and it fits perfect, snugly, but not too tight. The upper is thin leather, but I haven't seen a jazz shoe in this price range that isn't. I expect it to last just one season of (almost daily) use. Very good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: lvmom

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe. I just bought the wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an 8M. I am a size 7 1/2 in men's originally, but was told to get a half-size up. I should've went a whole size up and purchased a 9M. The shoes are nice and everything seems to be well with them. I have nothing against the company, this style or feel of the shoes, it was just I bought the wrong size. The shoes came faster than expected considering it was the weekend of the 4th of July.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: They fit & feel great. Got them in my street size
customer_reviews.text: They fit & feel great. Got them in my street size. Danced in them 3 times since I purchased them. No problems & no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: I could have danced all night!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for a musical at school. The last ones wore out , so I purchased these, and I am glad I went with these. They are much better quality than the ones I had in the past and am confident they will hold up well. They are comfortable, and have worn them all day at a theater festival performing with no discomfort. Make sure to follow Capezio's recommendation on fitting jazz shoes and you wont be dissappointed
customer_reviews.author: dabayers

customer_reviews.title: This amateur loves the shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any actual training, so I can't speak about the shoes from a technical standpoint, but they look really nice (I didn't realize they have laces along the top), they feel amazing, and I can dance! Sole is very flexible, minimal arch support, NO BLISTERS AFTER 4-HR REHEARSALS!!
customer_reviews.author: Reo

customer_reviews.title: and the fit was perfect. I also purchased a slip on jazz shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a street size 8.5 narrow (2A). I purchased a 9.5 medium for her, and the fit was perfect. I also purchased a slip on jazz shoe by Bloch in a narrow width, but she said this shoe was more comfortable and had a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Jazz Shoe - Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: These were the required Jazz shoes for my daughter's dance team. Purchased them in her normal shoe size and they fit perfectly. Happy I was able to receive them quickly with Prime membership as time was limited for me to actually purchase at the store. They were priced the same as the store itself.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing! Loved the design!
customer_reviews.text: First time having such shoes. It was a great product. Although I knew my shoe size, this was a whole new size experience.
customer_reviews.author: Yin X.

customer_reviews.title: I am returning this shoe because it was too small ...
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this shoe because it was too small. I ordered my normal size but with this type of shoe, you probably need to order a half size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I am overall pleased with this shoe. I was glad I read the reviews before I bought them so I knew to order a half size larger than I normally wear. ( In regular shoes I wear a 7.5 and I purchased an 8) They definitely run small. The size 8 just barely fits! I believe that they will probably stretch some since they are leather.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S Slagle

customer_reviews.title: Daughter is happy with them, also wears to Kung Fu
customer_reviews.text: I have bought similar Capezio Jazz shoes for my daughter so we knew what to expect. She likes them well enough that she also wears them to Kung Fu classes. They fit true to her street shoe size. Standard, typical, middle of the road Jazz shoe for classes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parks-Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Shoes arrived super quick, even though I don't have Prime. Really like the color, it's not as baring as the more common black or white Jazz Shoes. They are comfortable and flexible and can fold up small to fit in a purse or small shoe sac.
customer_reviews.author: Mililani Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Capezio Lace Up Jazz Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Capezio black lace up jazz shoes. Fit as expected. Daughter is a 9. Street shoe with a narrow door. Size 10 (1/2 size up from shoe size.) fit well. They are supposed to fit snug for a proper dancer fit. Meant to be work with dance tights or very thin trouser sock like liners.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: both too large and too small
customer_reviews.text: i had a size 10m capezio before which was too small in both length and width. i decided after reading the reviews on this that i should go up a size (my street size is 10). i purchased the 11M which is now 1/2 inch too long and yet still VERY tight across the instep - uncomfortably so. i'm hoping it will stretch with wear. if you usually wear wide width shoes - BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a school production last year and I am using them again for this year. No arch support, as expected for Jazz shoes. They only have a heal and toe pad. they last a long time. Id say get .5 up. My feet are 9.5 but I need a 10.
customer_reviews.author: Dorrie Rene Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Way too SMALL and the sizing that they give you is totally incorrect!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what planet they are living on with these SIZING "figures"..... And, I read the reviews and ordered my daughter a full size bigger than what she wears in every other shoe in her wardrobe, and these are still so tiny and small, she could barely fit half of her foot inside of the dance shoe. You should get a new shoe maker or at least, warn everyone that buys these shoes to order them 2 full sizes bigger than they normally do.......
customer_reviews.author: Dawn A.

customer_reviews.title: I like these dance shoes but like several reviews that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these dance shoes but like several reviews that I have read they definitely run short. I wear a size 5 shoe, however, I had to have a size six and could have gone up to a six and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Marcenia O. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes for belly dancing!
customer_reviews.text: I needed some shoes for a belly dance class, barefoot wasn't working for me. These are extremely light and feel like a second skin, but with enough sole to lessen the impact. They run a little short, but I've come to expect that with Capezio shoes. You might want to order a half-size up if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: very comfy better than any brands we tried in the retail stores
customer_reviews.text: Very soft leather. My daughter wears kids size 2. She just turned 8. The size 4 fits her well, right width and a little room in the toe area, very comfy better than any brands we tried in the retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: L2

customer_reviews.title: my daughter loves them and finds them very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs a bit small so I ordered a half size bigger. Other than that, my daughter loves them and finds them very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISSY M

customer_reviews.title: They are pretty much still comfortable enough to use for dance
customer_reviews.text: This ran a bit smaller than I expected. My last dance shoes are 6 1/2 so i got the same size and they are a bit to tight.. The color is what I expected and I am expecting them to stretch a bit. They are pretty much still comfortable enough to use for dance.
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight like glove. With a hammer toe on each foot
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 1/2 street shoe and ordered a size 9. Fits tight like glove. With a hammer toe on each foot, wish they were a bit wider. I also added a thin inner sole, as there is virtually no cushion or support under arches. Using as beginner training shoes for Irish dance.
customer_reviews.author: Yogisher

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great but run small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my normal shoe size and it was too small, so ordered 1/2 size larger. A quick and easy exchange resulted in a new pair at my door in 2 days. I wear them twice a week for line dancing and they feel good and work great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for dance
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, soft leather and just right for dance lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Jo A.

customer_reviews.title: Jazz Oxford is my favorite style of dance show and I trust Capezio to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these shoes before for at least five years and they lasted that long. This new pair arrived quickly. They are well-made and fit snug (as expected) and will stretch with wear. Jazz Oxford is my favorite style of dance show and I trust Capezio to make high-quality shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Aksana Vasilyeva

customer_reviews.title: Good Jazzzzzzz Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 10W. Normally I wear a 9-9.5 in women shoes. The 10W was a little too big but it was bare able. This is my first pair of jazz shoes so I wouldn't have any knowledge of how it feels or how it's suppose to "work". I just know after 4 hours of dancing my feet was cramped and in serious pain. Shipping was pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tia😁

customer_reviews.title: I like them, they're exactly what Jazz Shoes are suppose ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe runs 1/2 to 1 whole size small, there is no real arch support but you can put some in, the heel is very rubbery, it is not a hard sole. I like them, they're exactly what Jazz Shoes are suppose to be.
customer_reviews.author: Reneesmiles

product_meta.title: Capezio Women's EJ1 E-Series Jazz Shoe
product_meta.description: Salvatore Capezio was born in 1871 in Muro Lucano, Italy. Uninterested in following in his father's footsteps as a construction engineer, he became an artist of his own right, a cobbler. In 1887, at the age of 17, he opened his shop on Broadway and 39th Street, diagonally across from the old Metropolitan Opera House in New York City. Soon, the shop became a meeting place for dancers who would stop by to discuss their needs and to get a pair of his shoes. As Capezio's popularity grew, dancers from around the world made it a point to visit him and purchase his shoes. The innovation of the products that Salvatore Capezio created and the camaraderie he shared with the dancers molded the direction that his company would follow. In this image, the Capezio brand was established to promote and recognize ongoing achievements and participation in dance. Capezio products remain in the forefront in quality and in technological advances with innovations like the split-sole, the stretch-insert, the Dansneaker and the Tapsneaker. Capezio believes that their success is dependent upon the individual commitment of each customer to continually set new standards of creativity and performance, while preserving a reputation for dependability and distinction. Capezio pledges their support and dedication to the advancement of dance, theater and recreation in communities worldwide.
feature_bullets: Low-cut dance shoe featuring lace-up vamp with tonal eyelets and rounded toe
Heel cup with Achilles relief for comfort
